column5: Leaving for Lac Seul friday and going Walleye fishing. What bait is the best for this time of year? Have never fished Lac Seul or Walleye before....... ALL HELP APPRECIATTED. Thanks, Glenn
Crawlers, Minnows, Leeches, Plastics, Cranks - pick your poison.
Just about any bare hook will do. You'll have fun.

I like to bottom bounce with a minnow or leach until I find a large concentration of fish, and then I go with a 1/4 jig or bigger with a minnow or leach. I do not fish much with crawlers because small fish seem to pull them off the hook. I do hear from neighboring cabins that they love to fish with crawlers, and some use salted minnows, so it is your own preference. Just about any peice of meat on the end of a hook will produce.
Thanks for the help guys. We are really looking forward to fishing on Lac Seul and Im sure your input will help make our trip a success. Thanks Again, Glenn
Just got back from Lac Seul. Fished minnows, leaches and crawlers. We caught fish on all 3. Personally, my 5 biggest fish 23"-25" came on crawlers and a slip bobber. Any bait will work fine.
